# Sprint Planning Checklist

Use this checklist to ensure effective sprint planning facilitated by the Scrum Master.

## Pre-Planning (1-2 days before)
- [ ] Product backlog is refined and prioritized by Product Manager
- [ ] Top stories have clear acceptance criteria
- [ ] Technical dependencies identified by Developers
- [ ] Design work completed for sprint scope (UX Designer confirmation)
- [ ] Previous sprint retrospective action items reviewed
- [ ] Team capacity calculated (account for PTO, holidays, meetings)
- [ ] Definition of Done is up-to-date and visible

## Sprint Planning Meeting - Part 1: What to Build
- [ ] Sprint goal defined and agreed upon
- [ ] Product Manager presents prioritized backlog items
- [ ] Team reviews and discusses each story
- [ ] Acceptance criteria clarified and questions answered
- [ ] UX Designer reviews design requirements
- [ ] QA Lead reviews testability and quality gates
- [ ] Dependencies with other teams identified
- [ ] Team commits to sprint scope

## Sprint Planning Meeting - Part 2: How to Build
- [ ] Stories broken down into tasks
- [ ] Technical approach discussed and agreed
- [ ] DevOps Engineer confirms CI/CD and environment readiness
- [ ] Testing strategy defined with QA Lead
- [ ] Tasks estimated and assigned
- [ ] Total commitment aligns with team capacity
- [ ] Risk areas identified and mitigation planned

## Post-Planning
- [ ] Sprint backlog finalized in project tracking tool
- [ ] Sprint board configured and visible to team
- [ ] Sprint goal communicated to stakeholders
- [ ] First daily standup scheduled
- [ ] Sprint review and retrospective scheduled
- [ ] Documentation updated with sprint details

## Key Participants
- **Scrum Master**: Facilitates the meeting, ensures process followed
- **Product Manager**: Presents priorities and clarifies requirements
- **Developers**: Estimate effort, commit to work, identify technical needs
- **UX Designer**: Clarify design specifications and handoff status
- **QA Lead**: Review testability and define testing approach
- **DevOps Engineer**: Confirm infrastructure and deployment readiness

## Expected Outcomes
- Clear sprint goal that aligns with product priorities
- Committed sprint backlog with realistic scope
- Shared understanding of acceptance criteria
- Identified risks and mitigation plans
- Team alignment and confidence in delivery
